intro: Elephantopus vernonioides, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and it is often used in traditional medicine. However, it can be toxic to livestock, making it a concern in grazing areas.
